Commentary: he's run out! Here's the wicket and it's not the bowler's doing. Very average cricket from Chandimal, the non-striker. This was tossed up outside off, Dimuth stepped down to get to the pitch, tapped it wide of mid-on and took off for the run. A run which was there, and a run which he went for. It was his call, after all. But Chandimal is ball watching and has his back turned to him. Not even a call for no. The left-hander has reached the other end by now. Very unfortunate for him. Sarfraz waits after gathering the throw and absolutely batters the stumps. He's got his breakthrough
Commentary_short: Yasir Shah to Karunaratne, OUT
Dismissal_text: FDM Karunaratne run out (Mohammad Abbas/†Sarfaraz Ahmed) 93 (280m 205b 5x4 0x6) SR: 45.36

Maiden wicket for the debutant! Dilruwan has to go.

Yasir Shah falls on his back in a celebratory manner after taking his first wicket in 45 overs. Took the face of the bat's edge before hitting his arm and to the fielder.

Commentary: saved by the bat. Or is he? This skids through from back of a length and thuds into his pad in front of middle stump as he gets on the back foot. Plumb if there's no edge on it. Umpire has said not out. Chandimal reviews. He has walked well across the stumps....and replays show it is pad first. He's a long way across and I can see leg stump on the replay as this strikes the pad. Impact just in line of off stump. Only just. Would have been umpire's call if it was a centimeter to the right. But it isn't. He's trapped and he's out. Decision overturned.
Commentary_short: Perera to Sami Aslam, OUT
Dismissal_text: Sami Aslam lbw b Perera 51 (175m 130b 4x4 0x6) SR: 39.23

Commentary: bowled him! Dreadful shot. One of many pre-meditated sweep shots and he's succumbed to the pressure. A tiring, slow session has suddenly turned fruitful for Sri Lanka. This was slow, tossed right up at middle stump. He'd been flicking this for the most part, but now he exposes the stumps, and plonks his leg across to the off side. The ball is well away from where his foot is. He's locked and he can't get low because of the line. Hands come down late, ball sneaks under the bat and leg stump is tonked
Commentary_short: Herath to Shan Masood, OUT

Commentary: wrong'un beats him outside off and there's a big stumping appeal. He pushed forward was beaten. This is very close on the replay. He has stretched out well in front and on first glance, there appears to be nothing behind the crease. A shadow creeps behind the crease, but no tangible evidence of boot. Super close. I wonder if he'll get the benefit of doubt. Several angles tried and now the zoom-in...if he has anything in, it's an inch of rubber. And because of the doubt, he will survive.

Allows time for one more run

Commentary: well taken! Samarawickrama leaps to his left at short midwicket and holds on with two hands. It was dipping on him and he did brilliantly to keep his balance while getting his hands under it. Azhar had been using his feet for a while against Perera. But Herath is much slower in pace. This one dips and beats him in flight at a middle stump line and it's a feeble flick. A good innings, but he won't be happy with how easily it has ended
Commentary_short: Herath to Azhar Ali, OUT

Commentary: Masood jumps backwards at short leg and holds on. Wide of the crease from Yasir, gets it on a length outside off. KArunaratne looks to use the angle and flick it away, but his stride is not big enough. Allows it to get big on him, gets an inside. It lobs over Masood off his pads, but there's enough time for him to turn and get both hands on it....replays show Karunaratne hasn't nicked it. He walked. When he attempted the shot, he jammed the bat into the pitch. Replays show that was the only impact. Ball was nowhere close to bat or glove.
Commentary_short: Yasir Shah to Karunaratne, OUT

Commentary: A beautiful delivery gets the wicket of Chandimal! It was flighted on middle and leg, Chandimal adjusts his front foot to work it in front of square on the leg side, but sharp turn - coupled with minimal foot movement - helps the ball take the outside edge of his straight bat. Loops to first slip, who makes no mistake. The captain has to go.

Commentary: Mendis has been given out lbw and he has reviewed it. This one jagged back in, same line and length at the previous one. Beats the inside edge this time and traps him on the back pad. He was playing from the crease. If anything saves him here, it'll be an inside edge or the line of impact...there's no edge. On to tracking. Impact umpire's call! They've got Mendis inside 15 minutes. HUGE wicket. He shuffles across like he normally does but his feet weren't warm enough yet by the way he moved. It was a lazy shot in the end. Marginally in line, though. Wouldn't be overturned if he was given not out.
Commentary_short: Mohammad Abbas to Mendis, OUT
Dismissal_text: BKG Mendis lbw b Mohammad Abbas 18 (95m 72b 1x4 0x6) SR: 25.00

Commentary: Sandakan! What has he done?! Oh Yasir Shah, another five wicket haul. He's so good at this, at tempting the poor tailenders into suddenly switching off. This is a top-spinner, short and wide outside off. Tests his discipline and Sandakan fails. Goes for the cut without any transfer of weight. Reaching out in the end from deep in the crease and he has bunted it straight to point

Commentary: caught behind! Niroshan Dickwella. No review from the batsman, that's the end of him. Dilruwan Perera pushes one through, no turn, outside off stump. Top class bowling

Sarfraz survives, but Sri Lanka don't lose the review.

Commentary: he's come down the pitch and missed it! Sarfraz is gone! Rangana Herath has taken gotten rid of the tailor. He's grabbed the cloth right out and ripped the seams apart. Sarfraz was stitching everything together. Pakistan finally seemed to have found control, but now it's wide open again. This was dipping at leg stump, good length. He stepped down and yorked himself. It hit his pad, deflected low to Dickwella's right. He was lucky as this hit his right pad and stayed right in the vicinity. Swooped down and broke the stumps as Sarfraz looked desperately to get back
Commentary_short: Herath to Sarfaraz Ahmed, OUT
Dismissal_text: Sarfaraz Ahmed st †Dickwella b Herath 19 (57m 44b 0x4 0x6) SR: 43.18

Commentary: trapped on the back leg, bang in front of off stump, and it's been given! He has reviewed this. But it's out of desperation. I don't see him surviving this. Pitches at a length on middle stump, straightens as he plays inside the line. Goes past the outside edge and gets the back thigh...there is no edge. There isn't too much turn. Pitched in line. Impact, in-line. Wickets - umpire's call. He's gone. Pakistan need their bowlers to win this for them now.
Commentary_short: Perera to Haris Sohail, OUT

Commentary: bowled him! What a ball! Oh this is stunning from Herath to pick up ten wickets in the match and it's his 100th against Pakistan. Thirty-nine years and 197 days old. How many batsmen he might have done this to - draws him in outside off stump. Come here, he says, as he loops it wide. Amir takes the bait. Pushes forward and takes his time with it, because this is tossed right up. But this is Rangana. He gets it to dip. Well before Amir's stride is in. There's a gap between bat and pad. Herath has made a career out of it. Through his defence and hits the top of off
Commentary_short: Herath to Mohammad Amir, OUT

Commentary: this has to be out, surely! Lbw appeal, given out. Arm ball, length at off stump. He looks to cut it and misses by a long way. Reviewed, of course....but no chance. Nowhere near bat, and definitely smashing into the off stump. Pakistan's first loss in Abu Dhabi is sealed by their chief tormenter Rangana Herath. It's also his 400th wicket.
